Dear Ms. Canales:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on February 8, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 E mployee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all
of the following information prior to employment or at
the time specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior
to employment from persons unrelated to the employee
and which are less than 12 months old.
Three of four new hire files reviewed lacked dates the references were
completed. One of four new hire files reviewed had one reference completed
after the date of hire.
CCI Rule 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and
volunteers
(1) The licensee shall document, prior to employment,
that each employee and volunteer who has contact with
residents 4 or more hours per week for more than 2
consecutive weeks is free from communicable
tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable tuberculosis
shall be verified within the 1 year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the
last verification or prior to the expiration of the current
verification.
One of four new hire files did not have documentation a tuberculosis test was
completed.
CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.

(4) Training opportunities for direct care staff shall
include, but are not limited to, all of the following:
(d) Appropriate discipline, crisis intervention, and
child handling techniques.
One of three employee files who have worked over one year at the facility lacked
the yearly appropriate discipline, crisis intervention, and child handling technique
training. The employee completed Safe Crisis Management training on
03/03/2021, 12/02/2021 and January 2023. The employee was overdue for
training from 12/03/2021 until the January training in 2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility is completing a variance to request employees be hired prior to
verification the employee is free from communicable tuberculosis. Currently, the
facility hires the employee and conducts the preservice training at a different
location, away from the youth, while waiting for verification the employee is free
from communicable tuberculosis.
• Initial and updated treatment plans will be dated within 30 days or 90 days. The
initial and updated treatment plans were dated one day late.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period. The CAP’s addressed a staff member not using the correct restraint
technique, the door for the storage of the medication being unlocked and a staff
member falling asleep on the couch then falsifing the bedtime checks of the youth
were completed. There were five speical investigations during this report period and
two of the investigations resulted in rule violations.
The special investigations in Febuary and March of 2022 placed the facility on a
provisional license have been successfully completed and closed. Those CAP’s
were completed in August and September of 2022. The CAP’s for those

investigations covered staff having the proper credientials to be in the position
assigned, background checks being completed, providing specific trainings to staff
and ensuring staff had a good working knowledge of the material covered in the
trainings.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on review of the facility's budget and
the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
A new chief administrator started at the facility in the beginning of January. Before
the prior chief administrator departed a meeting was held to discuss the strengths and
needs of the facility. The facility was placed on a first provisional license in October
2022 for investigations that took place in late 2021 and early 2022. The corrective
action plans for those special investigations have been successfully completed. The
Chief Administrator identified the hiring process for the facility has improved, at least
monthly during team meetings restraint reduction is being discussed, new forms have
been developed to help with shift change and communication on shift has improved
as being positive changes for the facility. The facility is working to ensure supervisors
have a good working knowledge of CCI rules and contract expectations and have
added training to their weekly team meetings.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff and youth were interviewed and reported feeling supported, safe and having the
tools needed to do their jobs. Youth indicated treatment services were taking place
and their needs were being met.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on February 8, 2023.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
